items.question: Why has there not been more great series like this one?
items.answer: I so loved this series, re-watch it about every 6 month. Loved the mysteries, the history and Michael Kitchen. Just wish the USA could produce something so good.

items.question: In the span of 13 years, there's only been 28 episodes total?

The last episode (Elise) of this great series was not only a very intriguing episode, but also a very powerful one , with a very disturbing message at the end. My question is this: was this episode a true reflection of how the SOE operated during the Second World War? In other words, did they really send naive and expendable agents into Europe, in order to frustrate the brutal and merciless Gestapo as a distraction from the much anticipated D Day?
Who was the character Hilda Pierce, both beautifully and sinisterly played by Ellie Haddington, based on?
